body.p: I have been requested to forward to you the enclosed petition, & letter, praying the pardon of W G Yancey, convicted on this day, under an indictment for Grand Larceny, to serve one year in the penitentiary --

As you will perceive, the jury unanimously unite in the request of your excellency -- I think the case earnestly merits your clement consideration -- & I cordially join my friend Col Jno T Bunch in urging you to pardon the unfortunate young man -- If it were supposed that it would have any greater weight with you
the names of a hundred of our best citizens could be added to the petitioon, but as the Jury heard all the evidence & are were fully familiar with all the Circumstances attending the case, it was believed then unanimous prayer would be sufficient -- Hoping that you may feel it consistent with your feelings of duty to grant the request of your friends. I am, with assurances of high esteem --

Truly Yr Friend
John Young Brown

P.S.
Please mail your reply to
me at your earliest Convenience. This Young man has not yet been sent to Frankfort, & will not be, until we hear from you
